item.title: Jeanne add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Pasteboard pies and paper flowers are being banished from the stage by the growth of that power of accurate observation which is commonly called cynicism by those who have not got it...." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by Phyllis Diller
item.description: "Housework won't kill you, but then again, why take the chance?" -- Phyllis Diller

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Big sisters are the crab grass in the lawn of life." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "To acquire the habit of reading is to construct for yourself a refuge from almost all the miseries of life." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by Elizabeth Stone
item.description: "Making the decision to have a child - it is momentous. It is to decide forever to have your heart go walking around outside your body. " -- Elizabeth Stone

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "The problem with socialism is that you eventually run out of other people's money." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "I am extraordinarily patient, provided I get my own way in the end." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Never memorize something that you can look up." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "When you are courting a nice girl an hour seems like a second. When you sit on a red-hot cinder a second seems like an hour. That's relativity." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jeanne add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources" -- Albert Einstein
